title: George Shearing & Carmen McRae - 1980 - Two For The Road FLA
description:
George Shearing & Carmen McRae - 1980 - Two For The Road

There are far too few recordings of top-notch jazz singers backed solely by equally talented pianists, so this onetime meeting of George Shearing and Carmen McRae proves to be magical. Shearing recorded solo piano sessions a number of times during his long career, though he rarely played unaccompanied for a vocalist, with the exception of his meetings with Mel TormÃƒÂ©. McRae also had a prolific career and is still in great voice interpreting this standard-heavy collection. Shearing's inventive chord substitutions in "Too Late Now" are a treat, with the singer making a delayed entrance. Shearing is rollicking in "Gentleman Friend" (the album's only uptempo track), which also features McRae doing a bit of scatting. The lesser-known "Cloudy Morning" finds the pianist in a bit of an impressionist mood and also sharing the vocals, while McRae's powerful interpretation of "More Than You Know" is another gem. (AllMusic)

Track list:
01. I Don't Stand a Ghost of a Chance
02. You're All I Need
03. Gentleman Friend
04. More Than You Know
05. Cloudy Morning
06. Too Late Now
07. If I Should Lose You
08. Ghost of Yesterday
09. What Is There to Say
10. Two for the Road

Enjoy and share!
